psalm.text:
[[Ps 23,1]]The LORD is my shepherd; I shall not want.
[[Ps 23,2]]In verdant pastures he gives me repose; 
beside restful waters he leads me;
[[Ps 23,3a]]he refreshes my soul.Â 

[[Ps 23,3b]]He guides me in right paths
for His names's sake.
[[Ps 23,4]]Even though I walk in the dark valley 
I fear no evil; for you are at my side 
with your rod and your staff 
that give me courage.

[[Ps 23,5]]You spread the table before me 
in the sight of my foes; 
You anoint my head with oil; 
my cup overflows.

[[Ps 23,6]]Only goodness and kindness follow me 
all the days of my life; 
and I shall dwell in the house of the LORD 
for years to come.
psalm.title: Psalms

first_reading.text:
[[Tt 3,1]]Beloved: Remind them to be under the control of magistrates and authorities, to be obedient, to be open to every good enterprise.
[[Tt 3,2]]They are to slander no one, to be peaceable, considerate, exercising all graciousness toward everyone.
[[Tt 3,3]]For we ourselves were once foolish, disobedient, deluded, slaves to various desires and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful ourselves and hating one another.
[[Tt 3,4]]But when the kindness and generous love of God our savior appeared,
[[Tt 3,5]]not because of any righteous deeds we had done but because of his mercy, he saved us through the bath of rebirth and renewal by the holy Spirit,
[[Tt 3,6]]whom he richly poured out on us through Jesus Christ our savior,
[[Tt 3,7]]so that we might be justified by his grace and become heirs in hope of eternal life.
first_reading.title: Letter to Titus

gospel.text:
[[Lc 17,11]]As Jesus continued his journey to Jerusalem, he traveled through Samaria and Galilee.
[[Lc 17,12]]As he was entering a village, ten lepers met him. They stood at a distance from him
[[Lc 17,13]]and raised their voice, saying, "Jesus, Master! Have pity on us!"
[[Lc 17,14]]And when he saw them, he said, "Go show yourselves to the priests." As they were going they were cleansed.
[[Lc 17,15]]And one of them, realizing he had been healed, returned, glorifying God in a loud voice;
[[Lc 17,16]]and he fell at the feet of Jesus and thanked him. He was a Samaritan.
[[Lc 17,17]]Jesus said in reply, "Ten were cleansed, were they not? Where are the other nine?
[[Lc 17,18]]Has none but this foreigner returned to give thanks to God?"
[[Lc 17,19]]Then he said to him, "Stand up and go; your faith has saved you."
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
